text: The Bearstrikken son of Bran sets out to sink his chaos-touched claws into the mortal realms of men.

Beorg Bearstruck, a shapeshifter touched by the primal essence, carries the dual blessing and curse of bearstricken transformation. When the need arises, he morphs into a towering bear, a force of nature that strikes terror into the hearts of his foes. His warriors, the fearsome bearmen of Urslo, rally with growls and gnarls, ready to follow their chieftain southward. With every victorious conquest, Beorg's feral aura beckons feral ursine creatures to his banners. Mindless yet fierce, these feral bears join the relentless march, adding an untamed ferocity to the chaos Beorg aims to unleash. As he strings victories, the wilds respond, and the shapeshifter of Urslo's fury becomes an unstoppable force of devastation and primal might.
The Bearstrikken son of Bran sets out to sink his chaos-touched claws into the mortal realms of men.
The Bearstrikken son of Bran sets out to sink his chaos-touched claws into the mortal realms of men.
You are defending against the Ursfjordings!
Beorg, Son of Bran is a descendant of the Great Bear and is the mighty shapeshifting chieftain of the Ursfjordings Tribe.
The ravaging chieftain of the Ursfjording tribe is blessed by the Dark Gods.
Unknown to many, yet Beorg Bearstruck shares a blood bond with House Bokha, both descendants of the Great Bear.
Only the very finest beserkers may feast in the Halls of Urslo.
Bran was the legendary chieftain of Urslo and father of Beorg, who struck him down to claim his title.
The Bear Clans of Urslo serve the Dark Gods unconditionally.
He who fights with axe and shield is favoured among the Gods.
The Beserkers of Ursfjord hurl they're axes as if they were mere pebbles.
The Legendary Ursfjord tribe is small in numbers yet great in their victories.
He who chooses the Bear is worshipped by those not blessed with the feats of being Bearstricken.
The Beserkers of Urslo present their Gods offerings to they may bless their fangs, axes and claws.
The very essence of the Great Bear is channeled when the yellow glowing eyes set their sights on any prey.
Ability: "Bran's Fury'' when in Bear form
Missile block chance: %+n% for Infantry units
Armour-piercing weapon damage: %+n when in Bear form
Charge bonus: %+n when in Bear form
Attribute: Devastating Flanker for Bear units
Attribute: Vanguard Deployment for Marauder Hunter units
Reload time reduction: %+n% for Marauder Hunter units
Chance of ursine creatures joining Beorg after a battle victory: %+n%
Bearstrikken: Ursine creatures are drawn to the primal essence of Urslo and may be corrupted
At the edge of the frozen Fjord's of Urs towers the Halls of Urslo, home of ravaging marauding Bearstrikken norsemen.

Beorg's battle-standard is borne by the hardy warrior, Oerl the Young -- a entire bearskin whose grizzly head leers out from the top. The skin is touched by the power of Chaos, and the blessings of the gods is such that the banner radiates an aura of rage that drives the already fierce Ursfjordings into a terrible battle-fury that is impossible to contain.
Just another trophy to hang in some lavish hall

Originally the Watch Captain of Ubersreik, X was drafted to serve as Captain Guard in the Fortress of Helmgart. X is a bear of a man unfased by the cold climate of the Grey Mountains and has faced all kinds of threats in the melting pot that is Ubersreik. His presence on the Fortress Walls inspire the brethren facing any foe daring enough to climb their final fate.
This massive, yellowed canine is the sacred talisman of lordship amongst Beorg's people. He bears it about his neck. The talisman serves to ward off blows that would otherwise harm its wearer.

Nestled within frozen Ursfjord stands the imposing Great Hall of Urslo, a bastion of strength hewn from ancient timbers. Here resides Beorg, chieftain of the Bearmen, when he is not leading his warriors into battle or raiding distant lands. Beorg, a formidable were-bear of extraordinary power, commands respect and fear alike. In battle, he undergoes a savage transformation into an immense bear, bearing the revered title of Bearstruckâ€”a symbol of lordship among his people. Under his rule, the Ursfjordings flourish as warriors of the north, their legacy echoing through the grand halls of Urslo.

[[img:bullet_nor_gods]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Raze settlements and raise monoliths in their place to gradually pledge[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_gods]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_gods}}]]Allegiance to the Gods[[/tooltip]][[/url]][[col:green]], who will each grant factionwide gifts in lieu of the others.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:bullet_nor_monsters]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Hunt down creatures listed in the[[/col]] [[url:script_link_campaign_monsters]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_monsters}}]]Monstrous Arcanum[[/tooltip]][[/url]] [[col:green]]and defeat them in battle in return for unique and powerful trophies.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:rhox_beorg_dummy]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Ursine Creatures are drawn to the primal aura of the Ursfjording warriors, they may be corrupted and captured.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[img:icon_confederation]][[/img]] [[col:green]]Defeat the faction leaders of rival Norscan tribes to be given the option to form tribal[[/col]] [[sl_link:campaign_confederation]]confederations.[[/sl_link]]\\n\\nLearn more about Norsca [[url:script_link_campaign_norsca]]here[[/url]].
After Beorg's victory, some Ursine creatures are drawn to his banner

Oerl the Young is the latest heir of Clan Oerl, a fearsome bear-stricken clan of Ursfjord. He wades into battle carrying a horn that radiates chaotic magic.
Oerl the Young is the latest heir of Clan Oerl, a fearsome bear-stricken clan of Ursfjord. He wades into battle carrying a horn that radiates chaotic magic.
Beorg, Son of Bran is a descendant of the Great Bear and is the mighty shapeshifting chieftain of the Ursfjordings Tribe.
The Bearmen of Urslo, also known as the Tribe of the Bear by those they kill, is a band of Norscan beserkers. They are led by Beorg Bearstruck, Son of Bran.
The corrupting essence of the Bearstricken slowly takes hold of these feral bears as their minds warp in to chaotic madness.
The corrupting essence of the Bearstricken slowly takes hold of these feral bears as their minds warp in to chaotic madness.
Bearsson was the Black Sheep of the family who sought to rid himself of chaos and study poetry in Nuln, as punishment his mark of the Bear transformed him completely.
Bearsson was the Black Sheep of the family who sought to rid himself of chaos and study poetry in Nuln, as punishment his mark of the Bear transformed him completely.
Dark magic radiating bloodied claws are the sacred talisman of the Ursfjordings tribe, worn by Beorg Bearstruck.
Yellowed canines are the sacred talisman of the Ursfjordings tribe, these teeth are blessed with dark magic.
Bear form loses stalk, ranged attack, leadership abilities
Form offers powerful melee attacks, abilities, and armour
Form loses powerful melee attacks, abilities, and armour.
Form gains stalk, ranged attack, leadership abilities
Beorg as chieftain of the Ursfjordings tribe has both ranged and leadership capabilities.
Blessed by the Chaos Gods, Beorg has the ability to shapeshift into that he descends from, the Great Bear.
The Bearmen hurl their axes as easy as a trained warrior would hurl a mere pebble.
Channeling the very essence of the Great Bear, Beorg's primal fury cuts through masses of foes.
The Champions of Urslo are marked by the Great Bear, sharpening their primal instincts.
Right hand of Chieftain Beorg and fiercest of all Urslo beserkers.
None hurl axes further than the beserkers of the Ursfjordings tribe, catching ongoing vessels from a top the Fjords of Urslo.
All Bear-stricken clans fight with their ancestral claws strapped closely to their bodies.
The Bear Clans of Urslo are blessed by the Great one, and deem no rival clans. Especially those of the Wolf.
Blowing his horn, Oerl sends the beasts of Urslo into a frantic trans of bloodlust and rage.
Leader of the Tribal Hunters, Oerl knows the importance of catching large prey to keep his Clan fed.
The finest are considered the retinue of Chieftain Beorg, both fierce and deadly - they are the beserkers of the Ursfjord.
A corrupted axe stolen by Beorg after one of his victories against the Tribe of the Wolf, as a reward for their loyalty - he gifted it to Clan Oerl.
As he blows his horn the marauders of the tribe chant the name of their great leader. Oblivious and careless to any harm caused to them.

A corrupted axe stolen by Beorg after one of his victories against the Tribe of the Wolf, as a reward for their loyalty - he gifted it to Clan Oerl.
Once a proud would be poet, all that remains of Tyeddi Bearsson is untameable fury - which he unleashes with tremendous force.
A hornblower inspires allies with invigorating blasts from his horn, while striking fear into the hearts of enemies with its ominous resonance.
